channel.title: Tor 0.4.0.1 released
channel.description:
Tor 0.4.0.1 is released. A couple of interesting things are an experimental new padding scheme and a power saving dormant mode. A lot of memory and startup speed optimizations done.
https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-talk/2019-January/044826.html
One change that I noticed was for DNS handling. I want to make sure this change does not cause any accidental leaks on the GW:
> o Minor bugfixes (DNS): > - Gracefully handle an empty or absent resolve.conf file by falling > back to using "localhost" as a DNS server (and hoping it works). > Previously, we would just stop running as an exit. Fixes bug > 21900; bugfix on 0.2.1.10-alpha.

item.title: Tor 0.4.0.1 released
item.dc:creator: HulaHoop
item.description:
Tor 0.4.0.1 is released. A couple of interesting things are an experimental new padding scheme and a power saving dormant mode. A lot of memory and startup speed optimizations done.

https://lists.torproject.org/pipermail/tor-talk/2019-January/044826.html

One change that I noticed was for DNS handling. I want to make sure this change does not cause any accidental leaks on the GW:

o Minor bugfixes (DNS):
- Gracefully handle an empty or absent resolve.conf file by falling
back to using “localhost” as a DNS server (and hoping it works).
Previously, we would just stop running as an exit. Fixes bug
21900; bugfix on 0.2.1.10-alpha.

Read full topic
